Question_1.Context: The study focused on the preparation of chitosan/hydroxyapatite scaffolds loaded with heparin for bone tissue engineering.
Question_1.Question: What was the main purpose of loading heparin onto the scaffolds?
Question_1.Source: The results of the CAM assay confirmed the stimulation of angiogenesis and vascular attachment to the synthesized scaffolds.

Question_2.Context: The study evaluated the release of heparin from the scaffolds over time.
Question_2.Question: What was observed about the release of heparin from the scaffolds?
Question_2.B: A rapid release within the first 1.5 hours
Question_2.D: A constant release throughout the study period
Question_2.Source: Most of the heparin was released within the first 1.5 hours of immersion in water.

Question_3.Context: The study assessed the cytotoxicity of the scaffolds using an Alamar Blue assay.
Question_3.Question: What was observed regarding cell viability on the scaffolds?
Question_3.A: Higher cell proliferation with increasing heparin content
Question_3.B: Constant cell activity regardless of heparin content
Question_3.C: Decreased cell viability with higher heparin concentrations
Question_3.D: No cell attachment observed on the scaffolds
Question_3.Source: Regardless of the heparin content, cell activity remains constant throughout the entire evaluation.

Question_4.Context: The study conducted an in-vitro degradation analysis of the scaffolds.
Question_4.Question: What effect did the presence of hydroxyapatite have on the chitosan scaffold degradation?
Question_4.Source: The presence of hydroxyapatite, hampers lysozyme interaction with chitosan, delaying chitosan degradation.

Question_5.Context: The study used the CAM assay to evaluate the angiogenic response of the scaffolds.
Question_5.Question: Which loading concentration of heparin exhibited the best angiogenic response?
Question_5.Source: A slightly better performance from the scaffold loaded in the 0.5 mg/mL solution indicating that this loading concentration provided better angiogenic response.

Question_6.Context: The study analyzed the vasculogenic index of the scaffolds with different heparin concentrations.
Question_6.Question: What was the average vasculogenic index for the scaffold with the highest heparin loading concentration?
Question_6.Source: For the highest heparin loading concentration, most of the embryos died, showing a survival rate of 20%.

Question_7.Context: The study included a histological analysis of the CAM assay samples.
Question_7.Question: What was observed in the histological analysis of the CAM assay samples?
Question_7.B: Poor integration of the scaffold with CAM tissue
Question_7.C: Appearance of secondary blood vessels surrounding the CAM tissue
Question_7.Source: Integration of the CAM tissue and the scaffold and the appearance of secondary vessels surrounding the CAM tissue was observed.

Question_8.Context: The study investigated the effect of heparin loading on cell viability within the scaffolds.
Question_8.Question: How did the presence of heparin affect cell activity on the scaffolds?
Question_8.Source: Furthermore, the heparin concentration hinders cells proliferation.

Question_9.Context: The study analyzed the degradation of chitosan scaffold under enzyme exposure.
Question_9.Question: What role did hydroxyapatite play in the degradation of the chitosan scaffold?
Question_9.Source: The presence of hydroxyapatite, hampers lysozyme interaction with chitosan, delaying chitosan degradation.

Question_10.Context: The study assessed the angiogenic response of the scaffolds using the CAM assay.
Question_10.Question: What was the significance of the vasculogenic index results for the different heparin loading concentrations?
Question_10.A: Similar results regardless of heparin loading
Question_10.B: Higher index with increasing heparin content
Question_10.C: Better response with lower heparin concentrations
Question_10.D: No correlation between index and heparin content
Question_10.Source: From the vasculogenic index it was observed that for most of the concentrations, the results were very similar regardless of the amount of heparin loaded.
